intro: Gaudichaudia salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaved gaudichaudia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of willow trees, giving it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Gaudichaudia salicifolia is often found in grasslands and open habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
